Enroll in St. Francis Area Schools

div.p: St. Francis Area Schools is committed to timely, ongoing communication regarding decisions that impact school in response to the quickly developing nature of Coronavirus, or COVID-19.

The District is following direction from the Governor’s office and the Minnesota Department of Education (MDE) and expert guidance from the Minnesota Department of Health (MDH) and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

As of March 18, per the Governor's emergency directive, all Minnesota schools are closed through Friday, March 27. School districts are to use this closure period to prepare for continuity of learning. No instruction is taking place. St. Francis Area Schools Distance Learning plans are to be ready by March 30, if the Governor directs schools to remain closed. Information will be updated as it is announced.
Decisions may be made quickly and St. Francis Area Schools is committed to informing families, staff and the community of the situation.
Thank you for your ongoing support as we pull together during this time of uncertainty.

Grab-and-Go meals, which include breakfast, lunch and milk, are available free of charge for all community members age 18 and younger. Parents/guardians need to fill out the Emergency Services Request Form to receive the service (however, no child will be refused).

Meals have been distributed since March 23 at various locations throughout the district. Due to the Governor's Stay At Home Executive Order 20-19 effective March 27 at 11:59 p.m., please note the number of locations and times have changed.
Starting March 30, curbside meal pick-up will be at:

ul.li: St. Francis High School, 9:30 a.m.-12:00 p.m., Mondays & Thursdays
Cedar Creek Elementary School, 9:30 a.m.-12:00 p.m., Mondays & Thursdays
Meal distribution will continue at the Greystone Playground, 11:00-11:15 a.m., Mondays & Thursdays

div.p: Meals at all locations will include three days' worth of meals on Mondays and two days' worth of meals on Thursdays.

ul.li:
Pull up to the building, staff will be there to direct you.
Door #1 at Cedar Creek Elementary School
Door #13 at St. Francis High School
Roll down your window and communicate student names, how many meal bundles you are picking up and if there is a special diet order.
Staff will deliver your meal(s) on a cart next to your vehicle.
Do not open your door until the staff member is at least 6 feet away.

div.p: Educational Benefits - Many families have experienced income loss due to COVID-19. Please complete the educational benefits form if you have experienced a change in income. Help us help you by completing the form to secure funding for your child's school and offset additional expenses incurred during this emergency.

Emergency childcare for emergency workers in Tier I will be provided during regular school hours at no cost to families for ages 4 through grade 5 students. If requested, transportation to/from childcare, breakfast and lunch will also be provided. In addition to serve our families better, before and after school care will be provided for a fee. Register at https://district15.ce.eleyo.com, select Youth Grades K-12 Start Exploring > Emergency Childcare.

Location: Cedar Creek Elementary School
Hours: 6:00 a.m.-6:00 p.m.

NO DROP INS ALLOWED, please give staff 24-hour notice if childcare is needed. Call 763-213-1641 with questions, but due to the volume of calls please be patient, staff will get back to you as soon as they are able.

img.alt: Art: St. Francis Area Schools eNews Logo

div.h3: School playgrounds, fields, tennis courts, track closed to the public
div.p: Given the difficulty in maintaining the sanitization of playground equipment and the volume/frequency of students gathering, all St. Francis Area Schools playgrounds, fields, tennis courts and track are closed to the public until further notice.

This closing comes following the executive order from Governor Walz to Stay At Home and to practice social distancing. While it may be tempting for students to use these areas on nice days, we ask families to refrain from doing so in order to reduce any spread of COVID-19.

COVID-19 Staff Resources

hr.p: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a respiratory illness that can spread from person to person. Symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath, and may appear 2-14 days after exposure. The virus is thought to spread between people in close contact (within 6 feet) through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs or sneezes. It also may be possible to get COVID-19 by touching a surface or object that has the virus on it and then touching your mouth, nose, or eyes. Visit the CDC COVID-19 website or download a CDC fact sheet to learn more.
